meanings.sent1: The knife had a supersharp blade that could cut through anything effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Her supersharp mind quickly solved the puzzle with ease.
meanings.sent3: The supersharp wit of the comedian had the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: His supersharp intuition allowed him to predict the outcome accurately.
meanings.sent5: The supersharp focus of the detective helped uncover the hidden clues.

meanings.definition: Having a very sharp edge or point
meanings.sent1: The supersharp thorns on the rose bush made it difficult to prune.
meanings.sent2: The sword had a supersharp tip that gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The supersharp pencil point broke easily when pressed too hard.
meanings.sent4: The supersharp icicle hanging from the roof posed a danger to anyone below.
meanings.sent5: The chef's supersharp knife effortlessly sliced through the ripe tomatoes.

meanings.definition: To make something very sharp or keen
meanings.sent1: He used a whetstone to supersharp the blade of his axe before chopping wood.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith knew how to supersharp the edges of the swords he crafted.
meanings.sent3: She decided to supersharp her skills in painting by attending art classes.
meanings.sent4: The chef needed to supersharp the kitchen knives for the busy evening ahead.
meanings.sent5: The barber would supersharp his scissors every morning for precise haircuts.
